name: Hilton Garden Inn Detroit Downtown

reviews.title: Best Service Personnel
reviews.text: No matter where I was in the hotel, I was constantly greeted and treated as family by all staff I encountered. Front desk staff remember me by name and are happy to see me continue to return time and time again. After an arduous day at work, I know I can relax at the hotel bar and the staff there is always joyous and happy to brighten my day. My room is always clean and I can count on being able to relax in peace and quiet.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Great downtown location. Only stayed for one night business trip. Walking distance to downtown. Site staff were friendly and courteous. I was very pleased with the stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Downtown Detroit.

reviews.title: Excellent location for sports fans
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Garden in Detroit based on its proximity to Comerica Park. It proved to be just a couple of short blocks to get to the game. The hotel is within easy walking distance of dozens of great restaurants, clubs and bars. The Greektown Casino is only about ten minutes away if you enjoy a little gambling from time to time. Location is the hotel’s best feature.

reviews.title: Great for games
reviews.text: That does not mean other aspects were not up to par. The hotel had all of the amenities you’d expect at a Hilton Garden. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and clean and reasonably priced. We didn’t try the restaurant so I can’t offer any input on that.

reviews.title: Home away from Home
reviews.text: In summary, we’ll probably stay here again the next time we visit Detroit.

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.text: Spent just one evening here and found the rooms clean and comfortable, would advise if you have a room by the elevator that you may want some ear plugs, all you can here is the "ding" of the doors as they open and close constantly through the night! Other than that the food at the chrome grill was very good and the service overall was welcoming.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Excellent service, location, and room. Price was good staff was very helpful and friendly. walking distance from Ford Field, Comerica, and Greektown. Have stayed there before, and will stay there again.

reviews.title: Super Friendly Staff, Clean Rooms, and Good Service
reviews.text: I stayed at this property on business in Detroit for 3 nights. I was pleasantly surprised with the friendliness and professionalism of the all the staff at this hotel. From the valet, front desk staff, housekeeping and the restaurant staff, they were all wonderful and always greeted me with a smile. My room was comfortable, had a microwave, coffee maker, refrigerator and good bath soaps. Room was clean and housekeeping did a great job each day. The bar has some great food options and the service was very good. Hotel is close to Greek Town which offers restaurants, bars, and the Greek Town Casino. There are also other restaurants within walking distance. Hotel is Valet only and they are fairly quick at retrieving your cat.

reviews.title: Azsha-Thank You-Hilon Garden Detroit Mi
reviews.text: I had experienced car trouble, not quite sure how I was going to make it home. I called a couple of times to make sure my reservation was secure. It was also a busy weekend. I was received warmly by hotel reception, Azsha playfully joked about how many times I called. I think she realized that I was having a bad day, she turned it around and made me VIP for the day. This type of customer service is exemplary. Its a nice contemporary, clean hotel with amazing customer service. I would stay again.

reviews.title: Seen better days
reviews.text: This Hilton Garden Inn has seen better days. The rooms have quite a bit of mileage on them and in dire need of a refresh/renovation. Actually the hotel and the immediate surrounding area really need some revitalization. Having said that, it has everything you need and the microwave/fridge is handy. The service staff are very friendly and easy to interact with. If you're lucky enough to have breakfast included, the staff are very good in making sure you're well taken care of when you eat there.

reviews.title: An excellent and welcoming stay
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Gardens Inn from June 5 to June 18 2013 while relocating to the Detroit area for work. Marsha, Darrell, and the rest of the front desk staff were exceptionally friendly, welcoming, and helpful. They were able to give me great directions to work from the hotel. Patrick, Andre, and the rest of the valets were also very nice and helpful and quick to get my car whenever I needed it. I ate in the hotel most nights during my stay and the wait staff were very friendly and quick and the food was very good as well. The maid service did a great job. Overall, a terrific stay. They made me feel very comfortable during my transition and I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Typical Downtown Hotel
reviews.text: This was a nice hotel, but nothing too fancy. The staff was friendly and nice. Because it's in the city, it was a little noisy, but they did a pretty good job of sound proofing, as it could have been worse. The pool is small and not heated, so we hardly swam, even though we planned to spend both evenings in the pool. The whirlpool was nice - not too hot and big enough for several of us to sit. The exercise room is right next door to the pool, with a glass wall separating the two. There is valet only parking but we could see our van and it did not take much time at all for them to bring it to us. The bed was comfortable, with a memory foam mattress. There is no free breakfast, which we usually look for in a hotel. However, with the in room fridge and microwave, we made our own breakfast. There are plenty of nearby restaurants, including one in the hotel. We were told that if we ask at the front desk, they would give us a free pass to the nearby YMCA, where we can use pool, gym, etc.

reviews.title: Great Location and Service
reviews.text: We were in town over the weekend for a Tiger's game and chose this hotel based on distance to Comerica Park. We couldn't have picked a better location. Everything about the hotel was great. I really can't say enough good things about this hotel. Room was great --- clean and bed was comfortable. All of the staff -- front desk, restaurant, and, bar were all so very helpful and friendly. We walked to the game, walked downtown to the river, and walked through Greektown several times. In Greektown, we ate at Santorini, The Old Parthenon and Astoria Bakery --- all were very good and I would recommend any of them.

reviews.title: Awsome
reviews.text: I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel --- especially to anyone going to Detroit for a game.

reviews.title: great location and service
reviews.text: My family and I use this hotel every year for a two day stay. Their service is GREAT,accommodations are GREAT,food is the BEST ever. They have very personable staff. It is in a great location within walking distance to the sports parks and casinos as well downtown.

reviews.title: Misadventure in the Motor City
reviews.text: I recently concluded a four day/ three night stay at the Hilton Garden Inn on Gratiot and Brush Avenues in Detroit. We were in town for a family event and very excited about the location of the hotel for our group of about 70 people as its close to the Greektown area, the baseball stadiums and other city attractions.

reviews.title: Detroit Garden Hilton
reviews.text: Upon arrival by rental car, I will say that the hotel is nice and contemporary looking structure in contrast to the harsh city corner it sits on. You are definitely going to have city views from your room ( which is fine ) but expect parking lots and brick walls rather than gleaming glass building facades or ornate architecture. The hotel's lot seems to be run by an outside company, so there's a $20/day valet fee and your car will be amongst a mix of other parking customers coming to watch baseball at nearby Comerica stadium.

reviews.title: Excellent Location/Recommend This Hotel
reviews.text: Our check in was without incident, but I was reminded of the difficulty I had in securing a suite room when I originally booked. The reservation agent would not apply the negotiated group rate to a suite room, only to singles and doubles, and it took a few phone calls to the sales manager to finally resolve the issue. We had a one-bedroom suite for $169 night ( plus taxes and fees). The room was on the fourth floor on a corner. It was very spacious with plenty of room for my wife and I and our two daughters. The bathroom was a good size and the mini fridge and microwave would prove essential. The only complaint with the room was that the pullout sofa had a twin bed mattress. Having stayed at other Hilton properties with sofa beds, we knew this was unusual and it would not be enough room for our kids to sleep on comfortably for three nights. The front desk's initial response was that the sofa had a double bed size mattress and they had no other options other than to send a rollaway bed. We accepted the rollaway and found it amusing that it-the rollaway-mattress was wider than the "double bed" sofa mattress.

reviews.title: High price-poor quality
reviews.text: My wife had two interactions with the hotel manager during our stay and we were both very pleased with his responsiveness and efficiency. His name was David Kipfmiller and we appreciated his efforts in what was surely a busy weekend at the hotel.

reviews.title: Friendly staff, good location
reviews.text: The first contact that my wife had was over the sofa bed and the second was due to the daily poor service in the hotel restaurant. Again, I have stayed at many Hilton properties, so this is not a knock against the Hilton Garden Inn as a brand, but this property's morning hotel staff is just not well trained. The restaurant has some sort of number system that is used for ordering prepared items or buffet items and you are allowed to get some items ( fruits, cereal, toasts) but not others, though they are sitting at the buffet area ( eggs, bacon, potatoes, etc.). Drink service is erratic. You get coffee immediately, but juice and water is a game of hide and seek.

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Detroit Downtown Hotel Detroit
description: The Hilton Garden Inn Detroit Downtown hotel is located in downtown Detroit. Set in the heart of Harmonie Park, the hotel is surrounded by shops, restaurants and entertainment venues such as Ford Field and Comerica Park. Local businesses and corporate offices within walking distance to our hotel in Detroit, Michigan include Quicken Loans, Ernst and Young, PricewaterhouseCoopers and Compuware.
